name: SIRUM
headline: SIRUM is a âmatch.comâ for unused medicine. We connect institutionalâ¦
description:
SIRUM uses technology to connect, prioritize and simplify various sources of medicine. We help safety-net clinics access this medicine for their patients.

SIRUM is an innovative nonprofit organization committed to reducing barriers to health for underserved populations. Incubated at Stanford University, SIRUM draws from the academic and technology expertise of faculty and alumni to strengthen its impact and efficiency. 

SIRUM has become a leader in prescription drug donations, providing consulting and technical assistance to county governments, community clinics and multiple drug donor groups to establish redistribution programs

# Reimagining access for those in need
SIRUM drives the future of healthcare by connecting people with surplus medications.
[Donate Medicine](http://sirum.org/</donate/>)[Receive Medicine](http://sirum.org/</receive-medicine>)[Support Our Work](http://sirum.org/</support-our-work/>)
## Why medicine?
Because our health is a fundamental part of being human. Without it, we have nothing.
50 million Americans don’t take their prescribed medication because they face costs that are too high. With soaring copays, deductibles, and insurance costs, many people are making impossible choices between medications, food and housing, gas to get to work, and more.Not taking your medications, however, often leads to even worse outcomes—heart attacks, strokes, and even higher costs. This is our nation’s most critical problem, but it doesn’t have to be.That’s why we’re here. SIRUM provides access so everyone gets the care they deserve.
![](https://sirum.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/homepage-tiny-stats-1-2x.png)
## SIRUM saves medicine to save lives
We’re national drug donation law experts and the country’s largest redistributor of surplus medicine. Up to $11B of unexpired, unopened medicine goes to waste every year. Powered by technology, SIRUM helps organizations like nursing homes, pharmacies and manufacturers to donate their unused medicine and get it to where it’s needed most. 
[Learn More](http://sirum.org/<https:/sirum.org/about-us/>)
![](https://sirum.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/hospital-1.png)
![](https://sirum.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/arrow-1.png)
![](https://sirum.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/sirum-icon-1.png)
![](https://sirum.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/arrow-1.png)
![](https://sirum.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/pharm-1.png)
### 1
Individuals and organizations donate their surplus medicine instead of destroying it.
### 2
SIRUM matches donated medicine to community partners who need it.
### 3
Community partners provide donated medicine to patients who otherwise wouldn’t have access.
![](https://sirum.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/hospital-1.png)
### 1
Individuals and organizations donate their surplus medicine instead of destroying it.
![](https://sirum.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/arrow-down.png)![](https://sirum.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/sirum-icon-1.png)
### 2
SIRUM matches donated medicine to community partners who need it.
![](https://sirum.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/arrow-down.png)![](https://sirum.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/pharm-1.png)
### 3
Community partners provide donated medicine to patients who otherwise wouldn’t have access.
## Our impact
### 00,000
donations shipped through our platform
### $000,000,000
of medicine redistributed to partners
### 0,000,000
prescriptions donated to help people in need
## Curious about our daily impact?
We’re dedicated to capturing our impact through real-time records and metrics.
[Check out our live donation data](http://sirum.org/<http:/>)
## The impact is real
  * ![](https://sirum.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/homepage-tiny-quotes-1.png)
Some drugs that have gone through SIRUM’s system are almost literally worth their weight in gold.
**New York Times**
  * ![](https://sirum.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/homepage-tiny-quotes-1.png)
SIRUM, 'Match.com for unused meds,' has tripled in size and isn't stopping anytime soon... If it succeeds, the world will be a better place.
**Forbes**
  * ![](https://sirum.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/homepage-tiny-quotes-1.png)
SIRUM was designed to make it easy for institutions to donate medicines with the assurance that they would be safely transported and dispensed to people who need them.
**New York Times**
  * ![](https://sirum.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/homepage-tiny-quotes-1.png)
It is unconscionable to think that, every day, millions of Americans are forced to choose between their health and their ability to otherwise survive and support their families. SIRUM has the expertise and patented technologies necessary to right this egregious wrong, by scaling its innovative solution further and faster.
**Audacious Project at TED**

![](https://sirum.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/homepage-tiny-impact-1.png)

generated_description:
### Company Overview: SIRUM

**Mission**
SIRUM is essentially a "match.com" for unused medicine. Its mission is to connect surplus medications with those who need them most, particularly underserved populations who struggle with healthcare access. By simplifying and streamlining the donation process, SIRUM helps safety-net clinics to obtain vital medications for their patients.

**Background**
Founded in 2015 and incubated at Stanford University, SIRUM has leveraged its academic roots to become a key player in the nonprofit sector focused on healthcare. With the guidance of Stanford faculty and alumni, SIRUM has grown into a leader in prescription drug donations and has provided critical consulting and technical assistance to various stakeholders including county governments, community clinics, and drug donor organizations.

**Location and Team**
Based in Palo Alto, California, SIRUM currently employs a team of 15 dedicated individuals.

**Core Activities**
SIRUM operates as a national redistributor of surplus medicine, handling what is estimated to be around $11 billion worth of unexpired, unopened medications that go to waste each year. The organization facilitates the donation process by:

1. **Collecting Surplus Medicine**: Individuals and organizations can donate excess medications instead of discarding them.
2. **Matching Donated Medicine**: SIRUM utilizes technology to connect this surplus with community partners that need it.
3. **Distributing to Patients**: Community partners provide the medications to patients who lack access otherwise.

By coordinating the donation and redistribution of medicines, SIRUM plays a vital role in enhancing healthcare access.

**Current Initiatives**
Recently, SIRUM has partnered with Good Pill to expand its impact into Illinois, showcasing its commitment to reaching more communities. They actively encourage all stakeholders, including individuals, manufacturers, and pharmacies, to get involved through their donation and medicine distribution efforts.

**Impact**
SIRUM proudly showcases its impressive metrics, which highlight the sheer volume of medicine redistributed and the number of individuals positively affected. The commitment to capturing real-time impacts is a cornerstone of their transparency and accountability.

**Why It Matters**
In a landscape where 50 million Americans forgo necessary medications due to prohibitive costs, SIRUM addresses a critical healthcare crisis. Their approach not only saves medicine but also lives, allowing individuals to prioritize their health without the financial burden that often accompanies it.

**Get Involved**
To learn more or participate, visit SIRUM’s website at [sirum.org](http://sirum.org). Your involvement can make a significant difference in the lives of those in need.

### Conclusion
SIRUM stands out as an innovative nonprofit that leverages technology to tackle the critical issue of medicine waste while enhancing access to life-saving medications for the underserved. If you're looking to make a tangible difference in healthcare, consider supporting their mission.
